tool_description: Validates etymological claims by cross-referencing multiple sources and identifying discrepancies or confirmations across different reference materials.

source_references.description: List of reference sources to check against

validation_criteria.description: Aspects to validate: origin_language, dating, semantic_development, phonetic_changes

error_messages: Insufficient sources: Provide at least 2 reference sources for meaningful cross-validation.
Invalid validation criteria: Use valid criteria: origin_language, dating, semantic_development, phonetic_changes.
Sources unavailable: One or more specified reference sources could not be accessed.
No validation data: The etymology could not be found in any of the specified sources.
usage: Input a primary etymological claim and specify reference sources for validation. Choose validation criteria to focus the analysis. Returns consensus assessment and source agreements/disagreements.

consensus_level.description: Overall agreement level: strong_consensus, moderate_consensus, disputed, insufficient_data

source_agreements.description: Points where sources agree with the primary etymology

source_conflicts.description: Points where sources disagree or contradict

validation_summary.description: Summary of validation findings and recommendations
